instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a boosts to 20v, charges battery, doesn't see the ssd
threads.message:
What can it be? the SSD has power, but it's not seen, can't boot from external either because the USB C dock doesn't get any power from the board and doesn't turn on.
any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a boosts to 20v, charges battery, doesn't see the ssd
threads.message:
Not recognizing SSD is common failure on this board.
Strange that no USB activity, in your case.

Any history available?
Look close to J4700 for corrosion.
Check <CHIP>U7860</CHIP>/65/80 voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a boosts to 20v, charges battery, doesn't see the ssd
threads.message: Trash probably bad SSD or SSD controllers.
